department.dept_long_name: Department of Earth and Planetary Sciences

course.title: Environmental Modeling
course.meeting_text: W., Th., 2:30–4 plus one to three hours of computer-based laboratory work per week.
course.faculty_text: Steven C. Wofsy and Daniel J. Jacob
course.description: Chemical transport models: principles, numerical methods. Inverse models: Bayes' theorem, optimal estimation, Kalman filter, adjoint methods. Analysis of environmental data: visualization, time series analysis, Monte Carlo methods, statistical assessment. Students prepare projects and presentations.
course.prerequisites: Applied Mathematics 105; a course in atmospheric chemistry (EPS 133 or 200 or equivalent); or permission of the instructors.
course.notes: Students specializing in this area are expected to take EPS 200 and 236. EPS 236 may also serve as an introduction to modeling and applied statistics for other students.
